abstract.p: James Middleton letter about April 8 article on Handel's Messiah says that article should not have been published on Easter Sunday (M)

block.p: While Michael Marissen's article provided challenging food for thought, the decision to run it on Easter morning, the holiest day of the Christian year, was unfortunate. I was saddened but curious to see Mr. Marissen debunk the theory -- which I had been taught in grad school -- that Handel's Old Testament oratorios were patronized by a largely Jewish audience. I wonder, however, in the absence of hard facts, who is served by this information? If the origins of ''Messiah'' are indeed anti-Semitic, it seems safe to say that it has successfully outlived them.
